announcements.title: Amazon Route 53 Domains adds support for .ai, and other top-level domains
announcements.summary: Amazon Route 53 Domains has expanded its domain registration service to support ten new top-level domains (TLDs), including .ai, .nz, .shop, .bot, .moi, .spot, .free, .deal, .now, and .hot. This expansion gives customers more options for establishing their online presence with domain names tailored to specific industries, regions, or purposes directly through AWS.

announcements.title: EC2 Auto Scaling Introduces New Mechanisms for Group Deletion Protection
announcements.summary: AWS EC2 Auto Scaling has introduced a new IAM policy condition key called `autoscaling:ForceDelete` that controls whether Auto Scaling groups can be deleted while they still contain running instances. This condition key works with the `DeleteAutoScalingGroup` action and the `ForceDelete` parameter to provide administrators with granular control over deletion permissions. The feature serves as a safety mechanism to prevent accidental deletion of Auto Scaling groups that have active instances.

announcements.title: Amazon EVS now supports multiple VMware NSX Edge Gateways
announcements.summary: Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) now supports deploying multiple VMware NSX Tier-0 Gateways within Software-Defined Data Centers (SDDC). This enhancement enables better network segmentation, improved performance and scale by distributing traffic across multiple NSX Edge Clusters, and more flexible routing configurations for customers.

announcements.title: Announcing general availability of Amazon EC2 M4 Max Mac instances
announcements.summary: AWS has announced the general availability of Amazon EC2 M4 Max Mac instances, which are powered by Mac Studio hardware and represent the next generation of EC2 Mac instances. These instances are designed for Apple developers to run demanding build and test workloads on AWS for applications across all Apple platforms including iOS, macOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS, visionOS, and Safari. The M4 Max Mac instances offer up to 25% improved performance compared to previous generations.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS for Oracle now supports replicas in Oracle multi-tenant configuration
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS for Oracle now supports database replicas for instances configured in Oracle's multi-tenant setup, which allows multiple isolated databases to run within a single container database for cost savings and simplified management. This new feature enables customers to distribute read workloads across replicas for better scaling and set up cross-region replicas for disaster recovery scenarios.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect adds conditional logic and real-time updates to Step-by-Step Guides
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect has enhanced its Step-by-Step Guides feature with conditional logic capabilities, allowing managers to create dynamic user interfaces that adapt based on user interactions. This includes the ability to configure dropdown menus that show/hide fields, change default values, and adjust required fields based on previous inputs, making workflows more efficient and tailored to different scenarios. The announcement appears to be cut off mid-sentence regarding additional automatic updates functionality.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8i instances are now available in AWS Europe (London) region
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8i instances are now available in the AWS Europe (London) region, powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS. These new instances deliver up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to previous generation Intel-based instances, while offering the highest performance and fastest memory bandwidth among comparable Intel processors in the cloud.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8i and C8i-flex instances are now available in Asia Pacific (Sydney) and Europe (Frankfurt) regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8i and C8i-flex instances are now available in the Asia Pacific (Sydney) and Europe (Frankfurt) regions. These instances are powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS, delivering up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to the previous generation.

announcements.title: AWS Config launches 13 new managed rules
announcements.summary: AWS Config has launched 13 new managed rules that help organizations assess and govern security, durability, and operational use cases across their AWS environments. These rules can be easily discovered, enabled, and managed directly from the AWS Config console and deployed across individual accounts or entire organizations. The new rules expand coverage to additional AWS services including Amazon Cognito User pools and Amazon EBS Snapshots to help improve overall security posture and compliance monitoring.

announcements.title: Amazon Neptune Analytics is now available in 7 additional regions
announcements.summary: Amazon Neptune Analytics has expanded to 7 new regions: US West (N. California), Asia Pacific (Seoul, Osaka, Hong Kong), Europe (Stockholm, Paris), and South America (São Paulo). Users can now create and manage Neptune Analytics graphs in these regions to run advanced graph analytics. Neptune is a serverless graph database designed for connected data that enhances AI application accuracy while reducing operational costs and burden.

announcements.title: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Browser now supports custom browser extensions
announcements.summary: Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Browser now supports custom Chrome browser extensions, allowing users to upload Chrome-compatible extensions to S3 for automatic installation during browser sessions. This enhancement enables automation of complex workflows that standard browser automation cannot handle independently. The feature is designed for enterprise developers, automation engineers, and organizations requiring specialized browser functionality across various industries.

announcements.title: AWS expands Resource Control Policies support for Cognito and CloudWatch Logs
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded Resource Control Policies (RCPs) support to include Amazon Cognito and Amazon CloudWatch Logs. RCPs are organization-level policies that provide centralized control over maximum available permissions for resources across an organization. This expansion allows administrators to create policies that manage permissions for Cognito and CloudWatch Logs resources at the organizational level.

announcements.title: Microsoft Office, Visio and Project 2024 Apps now on Amazon WorkSpaces
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Personal and Core now offer Microsoft's latest 2024 productivity applications, including Office LTSC Professional Plus and Standard, Visio LTSC Professional and Standard, and Project Professional and Standard editions. These Microsoft Office 2024, Visio 2024, and Project 2024 applications are integrated as managed applications within the Amazon WorkSpaces platform.

announcements.title: Now available: 48xlarge and metal-48xl sizes for EBS optimized Amazon EC2 instances
announcements.summary: AWS has announced the general availability of new large-scale EC2 instances (C8gb, M8gb, and R8gb) in 48xlarge sizes, with C8gb and R8gb also available in metal-48xl configurations. These instances are powered by AWS Graviton4 processors, delivering up to 30% better compute performance than Graviton3 processors and offering up to 300 Gbps of EBS bandwidth. These represent the highest EBS performance available among non-accelerated compute instances.

announcements.title: Announcing availability of AWS Outposts racks in Rwanda
announcements.summary: AWS has announced that Outposts racks are now available for shipment and installation in Rwanda. Outposts racks extend AWS infrastructure and services to customers' on-premises data centers, enabling a hybrid cloud experience with low latency access to local systems while maintaining connectivity to AWS regions. This expansion allows Rwandan customers to run workloads locally that require proximity to on-premises systems.

announcements.title: Amazon MQ now supports Java Messaging Service (JMS) specification for RabbitMQ brokers
announcements.summary: Amazon MQ now supports Java Messaging Service (JMS) specification for RabbitMQ 4 brokers through the RabbitMQ JMS Topic Exchange plugin and JMS client, which is enabled by default. This allows users to run JMS 1.1, JMS 2.0, and JMS 3.1 applications on RabbitMQ and enables interoperability between JMS and AMQP messaging systems for easier workload migration.

announcements.title: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod introduces enhanced lifecycle scripts debugging
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod has introduced enhanced debugging capabilities for lifecycle scripts to help users more easily identify and resolve issues during cluster node provisioning. This improvement provides more detailed troubleshooting information when lifecycle scripts encounter problems during cluster creation or node operations. SageMaker HyperPod is designed to provision resilient clusters for AI/ML workloads, including large language models, diffusion models, and foundation models.

announcements.title: AWS Clean Rooms adds support for join and partition hints in SQL
announcements.summary: AWS Clean Rooms now supports join and partition hints in SQL queries, allowing users to optimize join strategies and data partitioning for better performance and cost reduction. The feature enables SQL hints through comment-style syntax in both pre-approved analysis templates and ad hoc queries. Users can specifically leverage broadcast join hints for large table joins and partition hints to improve data distribution and parallel processing.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect can now automatically select random samples of agent contacts for evaluation
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now offers automatic random sampling of agent contacts for evaluation, allowing managers to specify how many contacts they need to review per agent based on compliance requirements or internal policies. The system randomly selects the required number of contacts from a specified timeframe (e.g., 3 contacts per agent from the last week) to ensure fair coaching feedback. This feature includes new filtering capabilities to help managers customize their selection criteria.

announcements.title: Amazon EMR Serverless now supports AWS KMS customer managed keys for encrypting local disks
announcements.summary: Amazon EMR Serverless now supports encrypting local disks using AWS KMS customer managed keys (CMKs), providing users with greater control over their encryption strategy beyond the default AWS-owned keys. This enhancement helps organizations meet stricter regulatory and compliance requirements for their big data analytics workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon Bedrock Reserved Tier available now for Claude Sonnet 4.5 in AWS GovCloud (US-West)
announcements.summary: Amazon Bedrock has expanded its Reserved service tier to include Claude Sonnet 4.5 in AWS GovCloud (US-West), offering customers predictable performance and guaranteed tokens-per-minute capacity for mission-critical applications. The Reserved tier allows users to reserve prioritized compute capacity and provides flexible allocation of input and output token capacities to match specific workload requirements while controlling costs.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8gn instances are now available in additional regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8gn instances powered by AWS Graviton4 processors are now available in additional regions including Asia Pacific (Mumbai), Africa (Cape Town), Europe (Ireland, London), and Canada West (Calgary). These new instances deliver up to 30% better compute performance compared to the previous Graviton3-based C7gn instances and feature 6th generation AWS Nitro Cards with up to 600 Gbps network bandwidth.

announcements.title: AWS introduces additional policy details to access denied error messages
announcements.summary: AWS now includes the specific IAM and AWS Organizations policy ARN in access denied error messages when access is denied within the same account or organization. This enhancement allows users to quickly identify the exact policy causing the denial, rather than having to troubleshoot based only on the policy type as before. The change significantly speeds up the troubleshooting process for access-related issues.

announcements.title: Instance Scheduler on AWS adds enhanced scaling, reliability, and event-driven automation
announcements.summary: AWS has enhanced its Instance Scheduler service with improved scaling, reliability, and event-driven automation capabilities. Key new features include tracking of AWS tagging events, self-service troubleshooting through resource tags, automatic retry flows for insufficient EC2 capacity using alternate instance types, and dedicated EventBridge integration. The service has been re-architected with better orchestration and fan-out mechanisms to enable more intelligent scheduling based on AWS resource tagging events.

announcements.title: Announcing availability of second-generation AWS Outposts racks in 20 more countries
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded availability of its second-generation Outposts racks to 20 additional countries across Latin America, Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, including India, South Korea, Mexico, and South Africa. These racks allow organizations to deploy AWS infrastructure, services, and tools directly in their own data centers and on-premises locations for a consistent hybrid cloud experience.

announcements.title: AWS Transfer Family Terraform module now supports web apps
announcements.summary: AWS Transfer Family's Terraform module now supports deploying web apps that allow end users to transfer files to and from Amazon S3 through a web interface. This update enables centralized provisioning of branded web portals with federated authentication and user access controls using infrastructure as code. The enhancement allows for consistent and repeatable deployments of file transfer solutions for workforce use.

announcements.title: Amazon ECR now supports cross-repository layer sharing to optimize storage and improve push performance
announcements.summary: Amazon ECR has introduced blob mounting, a new feature that allows sharing of common image layers across repositories within a registry. This capability enables faster image pushes by reusing existing layers instead of re-uploading identical content, while also reducing storage costs by storing common layers only once. The feature is particularly beneficial for organizations managing multiple microservices or applications that share common base images.

announcements.title: SageMaker Unified Studio adds support for cross-Region and IAM role-based subscriptions
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio now supports cross-Region subscriptions, allowing users to subscribe to AWS Glue and Amazon Redshift tables/views from different AWS Regions than their current project. The platform also introduces IAM role-based subscriptions for enhanced data access and governance. These features help break down data silos and improve cross-organizational collaboration by enabling teams to access curated data assets from any AWS Region.

announcements.title: AWS expands managed integrations for AWS IoT Device Management service coverage to the Middle East (UAE) region
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded its IoT Device Management service's managed integrations feature to the Middle East (UAE) region. This expansion allows organizations in the UAE to better serve local customers by providing a unified interface for onboarding and managing diverse IoT devices, regardless of their connection type (direct, hub-based, or third-party cloud-based). The feature includes developer tools like unified interfaces and device SDKs to simplify IoT solution development.

announcements.title: AWS Glue is now available in Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region
announcements.summary: AWS Glue, a serverless data integration service for ETL (extract, transform, load) workloads, is now available in the Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region. This expansion allows customers in New Zealand to process and prepare their data for analytics, machine learning, and application development closer to their local data sources, potentially improving performance and reducing latency.

announcements.title: Amazon Quick Suite launches expanded size, faster ingestion, and richer data type support for SPICE datasets
announcements.summary: Amazon QuickSight's SPICE engine now supports datasets up to 2TB (double the previous 1TB limit) when using the new data preparation experience. The update includes faster data ingestion and loading capabilities, along with expanded data type support for advanced analytics and AI workloads. These improvements enable customers to handle larger datasets while maintaining strong performance and reducing time to insight.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS for Oracle extends support for bare metal instances to Standard Edition 2
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS for Oracle now supports bare metal instances for Oracle Standard Edition 2 with Bring Your Own License (BYOL), offering access to various instance types including M7i, R7i, X2iedn, and others. These bare metal instances are available at 25% lower cost compared to equivalent virtualized instances and provide full visibility into CPU cores, potentially helping customers reduce commercial database licensing and support costs.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 G7e instances are now generally available
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 G7e instances are now generally available, powered by NVIDIA RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPUs and delivering up to 2.3x better inference performance compared to G6e instances. These instances are designed for deploying large language models, agentic AI, multimodal generative AI, and physical AI models, while also providing top performance for spatial computing workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon Quick Sight expands dashboard customization in tables and pivot tables
announcements.summary: Amazon QuickSight has expanded its dashboard customization capabilities, allowing readers to directly modify tables and pivot tables by adding/removing fields, changing aggregations, and adjusting formatting without needing dashboard author intervention. This enhancement gives end users greater flexibility to customize their data views for specific analytical requirements, such as sales managers adding revenue breakdowns by product category to identify growth opportunities.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS Blue/Green Deployments reduces downtime to under five seconds
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS has improved its Blue/Green Deployments feature to reduce database upgrade downtime to typically five seconds or less for single-Region configurations. The Blue/Green Deployment system creates a separate staging environment (Green) for testing changes while keeping production (Blue) running, then enables seamless switchover without requiring application endpoint modifications.

announcements.title: Amazon Corretto January 2026 Quarterly Updates
announcements.summary: Amazon released quarterly security and critical updates for its Corretto OpenJDK distribution on January 20, 2026, covering all Long-Term Supported (LTS) versions including 25.0.2, 21.0.10, 17.0.18, 11.0.30, and 8u482. Amazon Corretto is a free, multi-platform, production-ready distribution of OpenJDK that can be downloaded from the Corretto home page or installed via Linux package managers.

announcements.title: Amazon Aurora and RDS for PostgreSQL, MySQL and MariaDB now support r8g, r7g, and r7i database instances in additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded availability of Graviton4-based R8g database instances for Amazon Aurora and RDS services to additional Asia Pacific regions including Hong Kong, Osaka, Jakarta, Seoul, and Singapore, as well as Canada Central. These R8g instances support PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MariaDB database engines across both Aurora and RDS platforms. This expansion builds upon AWS's previous R8g rollout, making the latest Graviton4 processor technology more widely accessible for database workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon EVS now supports VCF and VMware ESX software version selection
announcements.summary: Amazon Elastic VMware Service (Amazon EVS) now allows customers to specify supported combinations of VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF) and ESX software versions when configuring their EVS environments and hosts. This service enables organizations to run VCF natively within their Amazon VPC using AWS Nitro EC2 bare-metal instances, with automated deployment that can set up a complete VCF environment in hours through either the AWS console or programmatic methods.

announcements.title: Amazon Bedrock Reserved Tier available now for Claude Opus 4.5 and Haiku 4.5
announcements.summary: Amazon Bedrock has expanded its Reserved service tier to include Claude Opus 4.5 and Haiku 4.5 models, offering customers guaranteed tokens-per-minute capacity and predictable performance for mission-critical applications. The Reserved tier allows users to reserve prioritized compute capacity with flexible allocation of input and output token limits to match specific workload requirements while controlling costs.

announcements.title: Amazon MWAA now available in additional Region
announcements.summary: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) has expanded its availability to the AWS Asia Pacific (Thailand) region. MWAA is a managed service that provides the familiar Apache Airflow platform for workflow orchestration while offering enhanced scalability, availability, and security without the need to manage underlying infrastructure.

announcements.title: AWS Outposts racks support multiple LGW routing domains
announcements.summary: AWS Outposts racks now support up to 10 isolated local gateway (LGW) routing domains per Outpost, each with independent route tables and BGP sessions for enhanced network segmentation. This feature enables traffic separation between routing domains and allows both customer-owned IP (CoIP) and direct VPC routing (DVR) modes to operate simultaneously on the same Outpost. The capability facilitates network connectivity segmentation for different departments or use cases within an organization's on-premises infrastructure.

announcements.title: Second-generation AWS Outposts racks are now supported in additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded support for second-generation Outposts racks to the South America (São Paulo) and Europe (Stockholm) regions. Outposts racks allow organizations to extend AWS infrastructure and services to their on-premises data centers for consistent hybrid cloud experiences. This expansion enables organizations in and around Europe and South America to order Outposts racks connected to these newly supported regions.

announcements.title: Amazon S3 Storage Lens is now available in AWS GovCloud (US) Regions
announcements.summary: Amazon S3 Storage Lens is now available in AWS GovCloud (US) Regions, providing government customers with organization-wide visibility into their storage usage and activity. The service offers a centralized view across thousands of accounts and helps optimize storage costs, identify data protection opportunities, and improve application performance through detailed metrics and insights.

announcements.title: Amazon S3 on Outposts is now available on second-generation AWS Outposts racks
announcements.summary: Amazon S3 on Outposts is now available on second-generation AWS Outposts racks, enabling customers to run S3 storage services on-premises for data residency, low latency, and local processing requirements. The service offers three storage tiers (196 TB, 490 TB, and 786 TB) to accommodate different workload needs including production, backups, and archival use cases. Customers can manage their on-premises data using the familiar S3 API for storing, securing, retrieving, and controlling access.

announcements.title: AWS Clean Rooms now supports parameters in PySpark analysis templates
announcements.summary: AWS Clean Rooms now supports parameters in PySpark analysis templates, enabling organizations to create more flexible and scalable privacy-enhanced data collaboration workflows. This feature allows collaborators to provide different input values when running jobs without needing to modify the underlying template code. The enhancement increases flexibility for data partnerships while maintaining privacy protections in multi-party analytics scenarios.

announcements.title: AWS Databases are now available on v0 by Vercel
announcements.summary: AWS databases including Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, Amazon Aurora DSQL, and Amazon DynamoDB are now integrated with v0 by Vercel, an AI-powered development tool. This integration allows developers to build full-stack web applications and connect to AWS databases using simple natural language prompts, streamlining the process from idea to production-ready application in minutes.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect now provides agent scheduling metrics in data lake
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now provides agent scheduling metrics in its data lake, enabling easier reporting and insights generation. The feature includes interval-level metrics (15 or 30 minutes) such as forecasted headcount, scheduled headcount, and projected service level that can be viewed at both business unit and demand segment levels. This enhancement allows organizations to better analyze their workforce planning data after publishing monthly schedules.

announcements.title: Announcing Amazon EC2 Memory optimized X8i instances
announcements.summary: AWS has announced the general availability of Amazon EC2 X8i instances, which are next-generation memory optimized instances powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS. These SAP-certified instances deliver up to 43% higher performance, 1.5x more memory capacity (up to 6TB), and 3.4x more memory bandwidth compared to the previous generation X2i instances. The X8i instances offer the highest performance and fastest memory bandwidth among comparable Intel processors available in the cloud.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS now supports the latest CU and GDR updates for Microsoft SQL Server
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS for SQL Server now supports the latest General Distribution Release (GDR) and Cumulative Update (CU) patches from Microsoft across SQL Server versions 2016, 2017, 2019, and 2022. These updates include important security fixes and improvements, with specific support for SQL Server 2016 SP3+GDR, SQL Server 2017 CU31+GDR, SQL Server 2019 CU32+GDR, and SQL Server 2022 CU22.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS Custom now supports the latest GDR updates for Microsoft SQL Server
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS Custom for SQL Server now supports the latest General Distribution Release (GDR) updates, including SQL Server 2019 CU32+GDR and SQL Server 2022 CU21+GDR. These updates address security vulnerabilities described in CVE-2025-59499, providing customers with enhanced security patches for their SQL Server databases running on RDS Custom.

announcements.title: AWS Lambda announces cross-account access for DynamoDB Streams
announcements.summary: AWS Lambda now supports cross-account access for DynamoDB Streams event-source mappings, allowing Lambda functions in one AWS account to be triggered by DynamoDB Streams from another account. This enhancement enables organizations with multi-account architectures to centralize event processing or share events across accounts and with partners more effectively.

announcements.title: Amazon Redshift Serverless adds queue-based query resource management
announcements.summary: Amazon Redshift Serverless now offers queue-based query resource management, allowing users to create dedicated query queues with customized monitoring rules for different workloads. This feature provides granular control over resource usage through metrics-based predicates and automated responses, such as automatically aborting queries that exceed time or resource limits. The enhancement improves upon the previous Query Monitoring Rules (QMR) system by enabling more targeted workload management.

announcements.title: Amazon EBS now supports up to four Elastic Volumes modifications in 24 hours
announcements.summary: Amazon EBS has increased the limit for Elastic Volumes modifications from one to four per volume within a rolling 24-hour window. This allows users to more frequently adjust volume size, type, and performance characteristics as their needs change. The enhancement improves operational flexibility by enabling immediate modifications after previous ones complete, as long as the 24-hour limit hasn't been reached.

announcements.title: Amazon VPC Route Server now available in new regions
announcements.summary: Amazon VPC Route Server has expanded to 16 new regions, bringing its total availability to 30 AWS regions worldwide. This service simplifies dynamic routing between virtual appliances in Amazon VPC by enabling BGP-based route advertisement and automatic updates to VPC route tables associated with subnets and internet gateways.

announcements.title: Amazon VPC IPAM policies now support RDS and Application Load Balancers
announcements.summary: Amazon VPC IPAM (IP Address Manager) has expanded its policy support to include Amazon RDS instances and Application Load Balancers. This enhancement allows IP administrators to centrally configure and enforce IP allocation strategies for these resources, streamlining network and security management across AWS environments.

announcements.title: AWS IoT Device Management launches Wi-Fi Simple Setup for managed integrations
announcements.summary: AWS IoT Device Management has launched Wi-Fi Simple Setup (WSS) for managed integrations, allowing developers to streamline Wi-Fi provisioning in IoT solutions. The feature enables end users to connect Wi-Fi devices through QR code scanning, significantly reducing setup time and technical support requirements compared to manual configuration methods.

announcements.title: Amazon Bedrock introduces API keys to streamline development in GovCloud regions
announcements.summary: Amazon Bedrock has expanded API key support to AWS GovCloud (US) regions, bringing a feature that simplifies authentication for generative AI development to government cloud environments. API keys allow developers to quickly generate access credentials directly through the Bedrock console or AWS SDK, eliminating the need to manually configure IAM principals and policies. This streamlines the development process by providing a faster alternative to traditional IAM-based authentication setup.

announcements.title: AWS Transform custom adds AWS PrivateLink support and expands to Europe (Frankfurt) Region
announcements.summary: AWS Transform custom now supports AWS PrivateLink for enhanced network security and has expanded availability to the Europe (Frankfurt) Region alongside the existing US East (N. Virginia) Region. This service helps organizations automate repetitive code transformation tasks like language upgrades, API migrations, and framework updates to reduce technical debt. It's specifically designed for enterprise development teams and consulting partners managing large-scale, consistent code transformations.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect makes it easier to manage recurring overrides for hours of operation
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect has introduced a visual calendar interface that simplifies managing contact center operating hours for recurring events like holidays, maintenance windows, and promotional periods. The new feature allows users to set up automatic recurring overrides (weekly, monthly, or custom schedules) that provide personalized customer experiences without requiring manual configuration updates. This enhancement gives contact center managers at-a-glance visibility of operating hours across daily, monthly, and yearly views.

announcements.title: Enhanced Transactions view now available in AWS Billing Console
announcements.summary: AWS has released an enhanced Transactions view in the AWS Billing and Cost Management Console that provides significantly faster performance, with page loading times reduced from minutes to milliseconds. The new unified interface improves payment reconciliation, data accuracy, and overall visibility into financial transactions. These enhancements help customers reduce time spent on payment tracking and financial management tasks.

announcements.title: Amazon Neptune Database now supports R7g and R8g instances in 5 additional regions
announcements.summary: Amazon Neptune Database now supports Graviton3-based R7g and Graviton4-based R8g instances in 5 additional regions (Asia Pacific Hong Kong, Osaka, and Singapore, Canada Central, and US West N. California) for engine versions 1.4.5+. These new instances are priced 16% lower than R6g instances and offer improved performance, with R7g featuring DDR5 memory for faster data access and up to 30Gbps enhanced networking.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 X8aedz instances are now available in Asia Pacific (Mumbai, Seoul) regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 X8aedz instances are now available in the Asia Pacific (Mumbai) and Asia Pacific (Seoul) regions. These instances are powered by 5th Gen AMD EPYC processors and offer the highest maximum CPU frequency of 5GHz in the cloud, making them ideal for electronic design automation (EDA) workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect Cases now supports AWS CloudFormation
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect Cases now supports AWS CloudFormation, allowing administrators to manage case resources using infrastructure as code. This enables programmatic deployment and updates of Cases configurations (templates, fields, layouts) across Amazon Connect instances through CloudFormation templates. The feature reduces manual setup time and helps minimize configuration errors.

announcements.title: Amazon MSK Connect is now available in three additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: Amazon MSK Connect, a fully managed service for running Kafka Connect clusters with Amazon MSK, has expanded to three new AWS Regions: Asia Pacific (New Zealand), AWS GovCloud (US-East), and AWS GovCloud (US-West). MSK Connect allows users to easily deploy, monitor, and scale connectors that transfer data between Apache Kafka clusters and external systems like databases and file systems with just a few clicks.

announcements.title: Amazon Lex launches improved speech recognition models for English
announcements.summary: Amazon Lex has launched an improved neural automatic speech recognition (ASR) model for English that provides better accuracy for voice bots across diverse speaking styles, accents, and non-native speakers. The enhanced model reduces the need for customers to repeat themselves and improves self-service success rates. Users can enable this feature by selecting "Neural" as the ASR model option.

announcements.title: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod now validates service quotas before creating clusters on console
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker HyperPod console now validates AWS service quotas before creating clusters, allowing users to confirm they have sufficient quota availability before provisioning begins. This enhancement helps prevent cluster creation failures and improves the experience when setting up large-scale AI/ML infrastructure for training models like LLMs and foundation models.

announcements.title: Amazon Lex launches configurable voice activity detection sensitivity
announcements.summary: Amazon Lex now offers three configurable Voice Activity Detection (VAD) sensitivity levels - Default, High, and Maximum - that can be set for each bot locale. These settings allow bots to operate effectively across different noise environments, from typical background noise (Default) to moderate noise like busy offices (High) to very noisy environments like manufacturing floors or construction sites (Maximum). This enhancement enables better voice recognition performance by adapting to the specific acoustic conditions where the bot will be deployed.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect now provides agent screen recording status tracking
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now offers near real-time tracking of agent screen recording status through CloudWatch using Amazon EventBridge. This feature allows supervisors to monitor agents' on-screen actions during customer interactions (calls, chats, and tasks) in addition to reviewing audio and chat transcripts. The capability helps identify coaching opportunities and ensure compliance with business processes by providing visibility into both what agents say and do during customer contacts.

announcements.title: Amazon Redshift Serverless is now available in the AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) region
announcements.summary: Amazon Redshift Serverless is now generally available in the AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) region, allowing users to run analytics without provisioning or managing data warehouse clusters. The serverless offering automatically provisions and scales capacity while enabling data analysts, developers, and data scientists to get insights from data in seconds.

announcements.title: Amazon Inspector adds Java Gradle support and expands ecosystem coverage
announcements.summary: Amazon Inspector has expanded its vulnerability scanning capabilities to include Java Gradle support for Lambda functions and ECR images. The service now also covers additional technologies including MySQL, MariaDB, PHP, Jenkins-core, 7zip (Windows), Elasticsearch, and Curl/LibCurl. This update broadens Amazon Inspector's automated vulnerability detection across more applications and environments.

announcements.title: Announcing larger managed database bundles for Amazon Lightsail
announcements.summary: Amazon Lightsail has introduced two new larger managed database bundles that offer up to 8 vCPUs, 32GB of memory, and 960GB of SSD storage for both MySQL and PostgreSQL databases. These enhanced bundles are available in standard and high-availability configurations, enabling users to scale their database workloads and run more data-intensive production applications within Lightsail.

announcements.title: Amazon EMR Serverless adds support for job run level cost allocation
announcements.summary: Amazon EMR Serverless now supports job run-level cost allocation, enabling users to track and analyze costs for individual job runs with granular billing attribution. This feature allows cost visibility through AWS Cost Explorer and Cost and Usage Reports by filtering on specific job run IDs and associated cost allocation tags.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS for SQL Server now supports cross-region read replica in additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS for SQL Server has expanded cross-region read replica support to 16 additional AWS Regions, allowing customers to deploy read-only database replicas closer to users in different geographic locations. This enhancement enables better scaling of read workloads and improved disaster recovery capabilities, since read replicas can be promoted to standalone production databases during regional outages.

announcements.title: Amazon MQ now supports certificate based authentication with mutual TLS for RabbitMQ brokers
announcements.summary: Amazon MQ now supports certificate-based authentication using X.509 client certificates with mutual TLS (mTLS) for RabbitMQ brokers. This feature is available for RabbitMQ version 4.2 and above on M7g instance types, and can be configured through the RabbitMQ auth_mechanism_ssl plugin by modifying the broker's configuration file.

announcements.title: Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility) is Now Available in the Asia Pacific (Jakarta) Region
announcements.summary: Amazon DocumentDB, a fully managed MongoDB-compatible database service, is now available in the Asia Pacific (Jakarta) region. The service enables users to operate critical document workloads at scale without managing infrastructure, offering scalability and durability for mission-critical MongoDB applications.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 R8i and R8i-flex instances are now available in additional AWS regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 R8i and R8i-flex instances are now available in Asia Pacific (Mumbai, Hyderabad) and Europe (Paris) regions. These instances are powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS, offering up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to previous generations. The processors deliver the highest performance and fastest memory bandwidth among comparable Intel processors in the cloud.

announcements.title: Amazon Quick adds third-party AI agents and expands built-in actions library
announcements.summary:
Amazon QuickSight is expanding its AI capabilities by adding third-party AI agents and growing its built-in actions library to create a more integrated AI-powered workspace. The service, called Amazon Quick, aims to help organizations analyze business data and take action on insights without switching between multiple tools. This expansion addresses the problem of fragmented user experiences when working with various AI agents and enterprise applications for CRM, support, and collaboration.

Note: The announcement text appears to be incomplete, cutting off mid-sentence, so this summary is based on the available information.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 M8i instances are now available in additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 M8i instances, powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS, are now available in Europe (Frankfurt) and Asia Pacific (Malaysia) regions. These instances offer up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to previous generation Intel-based instances. The M8i instances provide the highest performance and fastest memory bandwidth among comparable Intel processors available in the cloud.

announcements.title: AWS Lambda adds support for .NET 10
announcements.summary: AWS Lambda now supports .NET 10 for building serverless applications, offering both managed runtime and container base image options with automatic updates. .NET 10 is the latest long-term support release that will receive security and bug fixes until November 2028, giving Lambda developers access to the newest .NET features.

announcements.title: AWS simplifies Client VPN onboarding with Quickstart setup
announcements.summary: AWS has launched a new Quickstart setup method for AWS Client VPN that simplifies the onboarding process by reducing configuration steps. The streamlined approach uses pre-defined default configurations to make it easier for users to create and set up Client VPN endpoints. This enhancement allows for quicker deployment of secure remote connections to AWS resources and on-premises networks.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 I7ie instances now available in additional AWS regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 I7ie instances are now available in three additional AWS regions: Asia Pacific (Mumbai), Canada West (Calgary), and Europe (Paris). These instances are designed for storage-intensive workloads and are powered by 5th Gen Intel Xeon Processors, delivering up to 40% better compute performance and 20% better price performance compared to I3en instances, with up to 120TB of local NVMe storage.

announcements.title: Announcing Apache Airflow 2.11 Support in Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow
announcements.summary: Amazon Managed Workflows for Apache Airflow (MWAA) now supports Apache Airflow version 2.11, which includes enhancements to help users prepare for the upcoming Apache Airflow 3 upgrade. The new version introduces features like trigger-based scheduling for delta intervals and other improvements to the managed orchestration service that simplifies setting up and operating data pipelines in the cloud.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8i and C8i-flex instances are now available in additional AWS regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8i and C8i-flex instances are now available in three additional Asia Pacific regions: Mumbai, Seoul, and Tokyo. These instances are powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS, offering up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to previous generations.

announcements.title: AWS Marketplace Seller Reporting now provides collections visibility
announcements.summary: AWS Marketplace Seller Reporting now includes collection visibility, providing real-time payment collection status in the Billed Revenue Dashboard and Billing Event Data Feed. This new feature allows sellers to clearly distinguish between invoiced, collected, and disbursed amounts, eliminating the previous gap between invoice creation and payment disbursement. The enhancement enables sellers to make better business decisions and reduces the need for payment status follow-ups with customers.

announcements.title: Amazon ECS now supports tmpfs mounts on AWS Fargate and ECS Managed Instances
announcements.summary: Amazon ECS now supports tmpfs mounts for Linux tasks on AWS Fargate and ECS Managed Instances, in addition to the existing EC2 launch type support. This feature enables memory-backed temporary file systems within containers, allowing performance-sensitive workloads to access fast, temporary storage without writing data to persistent task storage.

announcements.title: Amazon MQ now supports HTTP based authentication for RabbitMQ brokers
announcements.summary: Amazon MQ now supports HTTP-based authentication and authorization for RabbitMQ brokers, allowing them to verify user login credentials and permissions by making requests to an HTTP server. This feature is available for RabbitMQ version 4.2 and above running on m7g instances, and can be configured through the broker's configuration file. Users can enable this functionality by simply selecting RabbitMQ 4.2 when creating a new Amazon MQ broker.

announcements.title: AWS Config now supports 21 new resource types
announcements.summary: AWS Config has expanded support to include 21 new resource types across Amazon EC2, SageMaker, and S3 Tables services. This expansion enhances monitoring coverage of AWS environments, allowing users to better discover, assess, audit, and remediate a wider range of resources. If recording is enabled for all resource types, AWS Config will automatically begin tracking these new additions.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 G5 instances are now available in Asia Pacific (Hong Kong) Region
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 G5 instances powered by NVIDIA A10G Tensor Core GPUs are now available in the Asia Pacific (Hong Kong) region. These instances support graphics-intensive applications like remote workstations, video rendering, and cloud gaming, as well as machine learning workloads that require high-performance GPU computing.

announcements.title: Happy New Year! AWS Weekly Roundup: 10,000 AIdeas Competition, Amazon EC2, Amazon ECS Managed Instances and more (January 5, 2026)
announcements.summary: This AWS Weekly Roundup welcomes 2026 and highlights several key announcements including a "10,000 AIdeas Competition," updates to Amazon EC2, and new Amazon ECS Managed Instances features. The author mentions taking time off after AWS re:Invent to rest and is planning the next cohort for their "Become a Solutions Architect (BeSA)" program.

announcements.title: AWS Resource Explorer is now available in AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region.
announcements.summary: AWS Resource Explorer is now available in the Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region, expanding the service's global reach. This tool allows users to search for and discover AWS resources across multiple regions and accounts within their organization through various interfaces including the console, CLI, SDKs, or the unified search bar in the AWS Management Console.

announcements.title: AWS Transfer Family is now available in AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) region
announcements.summary: AWS Transfer Family is now available in the Asia Pacific (New Zealand) region, allowing customers to use fully managed file transfer services supporting SFTP, FTP, FTPS, and AS2 protocols. The service enables secure file transfers to Amazon S3 and Amazon EFS storage services, along with common file processing capabilities.

announcements.title: EC2 Capacity Manager now includes Spot interruption metrics
announcements.summary: AWS has added new Spot interruption metrics to Amazon EC2 Capacity Manager, enabling organizations to better monitor and analyze their Spot instance capacity. These metrics allow users to track running Spot instances, monitor interruption counts, and calculate interruption rates across regions, availability zones, and accounts from a centralized dashboard. This enhancement provides greater visibility into Spot capacity management alongside existing On-Demand and Capacity Reservation monitoring capabilities.

announcements.title: AWS Clean Rooms now supports detailed monitoring for collaboration queries
announcements.summary: AWS Clean Rooms has launched detailed monitoring capabilities for SQL queries within collaborations, publishing comprehensive metrics to CloudWatch. This new feature enables monitoring of query performance and resource utilization, improving observability for workloads at scale. Collaboration creators can enable this detailed monitoring to gain better operational insights into their Clean Rooms deployments.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect now provides the capability to store nested JSON object and looping arrays
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now supports storing and working with complex data structures like nested JSON objects and arrays directly within contact flows. This enhancement allows developers to build more dynamic automated customer experiences by saving complete data records from business systems and referencing specific elements within them. The feature also includes automatic looping capabilities for processing lists of items in customer service workflows.

announcements.title: AWS WAF is now available in the AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region
announcements.summary: AWS WAF (Web Application Firewall) is now available in the AWS Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region. AWS WAF helps protect web applications from common exploits and bots that could impact availability, security, or resource consumption. The service allows users to control content access based on specified conditions like IP addresses and query string values.

announcements.title: AWS launches simplified import of CloudTrail Lake data in Amazon CloudWatch
announcements.summary: AWS has launched a simplified way to import CloudTrail Lake data directly into Amazon CloudWatch, allowing users to consolidate historical operational, security, and compliance data in just a few steps. This enhancement enables organizations to unify data from across their AWS environment and third-party sources within CloudWatch's data management and analytics service.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect dashboards now support filtering metrics based on custom business dimensions
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect dashboards now allow users to filter metrics using custom business dimensions like divisions, product lines, or customer segments through predefined attributes. This enables organizations to customize their dashboards based on specific business needs, such as comparing handle times across different product lines to identify where agents may need additional training. The feature helps businesses gain more targeted insights from their contact center data.

announcements.title: Amazon OpenSearch UI supports CMK and increased metadata size
announcements.summary: Amazon OpenSearch Service now supports AWS KMS customer managed keys (CMKs) for encrypting metadata and has increased the metadata size limit for OpenSearch UI applications. This enhancement helps organizations meet regulatory compliance requirements while using the managed dashboarding service that provides unified analytics across multiple AWS data sources including OpenSearch, S3, CloudWatch, and Security Lake.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect expands automated agent performance evaluations to 5 additional languages
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now offers automated agent performance evaluations in five additional languages (Portuguese, French, Italian, German, and Spanish) using generative AI technology. Managers can define custom evaluation criteria in natural language and receive AI-generated assessments with explanations in their preferred language. The system also supports cross-language evaluation, allowing assessments to be completed in English even when customer conversations occur in other languages, enabling standardized evaluations across multilingual contact centers.

announcements.title: Oracle Database@AWS is now available in three additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: Oracle Database@AWS has expanded to three new AWS Regions: US-East-2 (Ohio), EU-Central-1 (Frankfurt), and AP-Northeast-1 (Tokyo). This service allows customers to run Oracle database workloads on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) managed Exadata systems located within AWS data centers. The expansion particularly benefits EU and Japanese customers with data residency requirements who want to migrate their on-premises Oracle Exadata applications to AWS.

announcements.title: NVIDIA Nemotron 3 Nano now available on Amazon Bedrock
announcements.summary: AWS announced that NVIDIA Nemotron 3 Nano 30B A3B model is now available on Amazon Bedrock, featuring advanced capabilities including native tool calling, 256k token context window, and high reasoning performance. The model uses an efficient hybrid Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture that delivers higher throughput than previous versions while maintaining the reasoning capabilities of larger models, making it particularly well-suited for agentic and coding workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser now supports WebAuthn redirection for local Chromium browsers
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser now supports WebAuthn redirection, enabling users to authenticate to websites using local FIDO2 security keys, biometric authenticators, and platform authenticators within their secure browser sessions. This feature works with Chromium-based browsers like Google Chrome 136+ and Microsoft Edge 137+, but is not supported on non-Chromium browsers such as Safari.

announcements.title: Amazon MSK expands Standard Brokers and Express Brokers to Asia Pacific (New Zealand) Region
announcements.summary: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) has expanded its availability to the Asia Pacific (New Zealand) region, allowing customers to create MSK Provisioned clusters there starting immediately. Amazon MSK is a fully managed service that simplifies building and running Apache Kafka applications while maintaining full compatibility with existing Apache Kafka workloads for easier migration.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS for MySQL announces Innovation Release 9.5 in Amazon RDS Database Preview Environment
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS for MySQL now supports community MySQL Innovation Release 9.5 in the Amazon RDS Database Preview Environment. This allows users to evaluate the latest MySQL innovation features while benefiting from a fully managed database service that simplifies setup, operation, and monitoring. MySQL 9.5 represents the latest innovation release from the MySQL community with various improvements and bug fixes.

announcements.title: AWS Secrets Manager announces improved secret sorting capabilities
announcements.summary: AWS Secrets Manager has expanded its sorting capabilities, allowing users to sort secrets by name, last changed date, last accessed date, and creation date (previously only creation date was available). This enhancement is available in both the Secrets Manager console and the ListSecrets API. The improvement provides better secret management and organization within AWS's fully managed service for handling database credentials, API keys, and other sensitive information.

announcements.title: MiniMax-M2 is now available on Amazon SageMaker JumpStart
announcements.summary: AWS has made MiniMax-M2, an efficient open-source AI model, available on Amazon SageMaker JumpStart for quick deployment within minutes. The model is a compact Mixture of Experts (MoE) architecture with 230 billion total parameters but only 10 billion active parameters, designed to be fast and cost-effective for AI agents. Users can deploy MiniMax-M2 through either SageMaker Studio's interface or the SageMaker Python SDK.

announcements.title: AWS Transform enables network conversion for hybrid data center migrations
announcements.summary: AWS Transform now offers automatic network conversion capabilities for hybrid data center migrations, eliminating the need for manual network mapping in environments with both VMware and non-VMware workloads. The service automatically analyzes VLANs and IP ranges from source networks and maps them to corresponding AWS infrastructure like VPCs, subnets, and security groups. This enhancement is part of AWS Transform for VMware, an AI-powered service that automates VMware workload discovery, planning, and migration processes.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser enables branding customization
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Secure Browser now allows organizations to customize branding on sign-in and session loading screens to maintain consistent visual identity. Users can upload their organization's logos, modify visual elements, and customize text content across all user touchpoints. This feature helps create a branded experience that aligns with company branding standards.

announcements.title: Amazon Redshift supports four new materialized view (MV) features on data shares
announcements.summary: Amazon Redshift has introduced four new materialized view (MV) features for data shares, enabling users to run create and refresh MV commands across multiple data warehouses and create MVs on shared MVs. The update also adds concurrency scaling support for the create MV DDL command, allowing it to scale automatically when the main cluster or workgroup runs out of resources.

announcements.title: AWS Deadline Cloud now supports direct job submission from the Deadline Cloud Monitor
announcements.summary: AWS Deadline Cloud has added direct job submission capabilities to its Monitor desktop application, eliminating the previous requirement to use the command line interface. This new feature expands compatibility with content creation tools that lack built-in Deadline Cloud plugins and makes it easier to submit rendering jobs directly through the desktop interface.

announcements.title: Oracle Database@AWS now supports sharing of AWS Marketplace entitlements across accounts
announcements.summary: Oracle Database@AWS now allows customers to share AWS Marketplace entitlements across multiple accounts within an AWS Organization. This means organizations can purchase a single Oracle Database@AWS marketplace offer in one account and use it across all their AWS accounts within the organization. The feature simplifies license management and enables centralized purchasing while allowing distributed consumption of Oracle database services.

announcements.title: Amazon ECS Service Connect enhances observability with Envoy Access Logs
announcements.summary: Amazon ECS Service Connect now supports Envoy access logs, enabling deeper observability into request-level traffic patterns and service interactions within containerized applications. This enhancement provides detailed per-request telemetry that helps with end-to-end tracing, debugging, and compliance monitoring. The feature builds on Service Connect's existing capabilities for secure, resilient service-to-service communication across clusters, VPCs, and AWS accounts.

announcements.title: Amazon Kinesis Video Streams now supports IPv6 for WebRTC
announcements.summary: Amazon Kinesis Video Streams now supports IPv6 addressing for WebRTC through dual-stack endpoint support, allowing developers to use both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses for video streaming from millions of devices. This update ensures existing IPv4 implementations continue working reliably while providing IPv6 connectivity benefits and simplifying the transition to IPv6 addresses.

announcements.title: Amazon GameLift Streams launches real-time performance stats and improved API error messaging
announcements.summary: Amazon GameLift Streams has launched new observability features that provide real-time performance statistics for individual streaming sessions, giving developers detailed insights into application performance issues. The update addresses developer requests for better visibility into session performance and resource utilization across different stream classes and GPUs. These enhanced stats enable developers to make more informed decisions about optimal GPU selection for their applications.

announcements.title: Amazon GameLift Streams launches Gen6-based stream classes and enhanced autoscaling for better performance and pricing
announcements.summary: Amazon GameLift Streams has introduced Gen6 stream classes based on EC2 G6 instances with NVIDIA L4 Tensor Core GPUs, delivering up to 2x better performance than Gen4 classes. The update also includes enhanced autoscaling with warm buffer capabilities, allowing customers to dynamically manage capacity scaling for optimized performance and cost-effectiveness.

announcements.title: Research and Engineering Studio on AWS Version 2025.12 now available
announcements.summary: AWS has released Research and Engineering Studio (RES) version 2025.12, an open source web-based portal that helps administrators create and manage secure cloud-based research and engineering environments. The new version introduces key improvements including tag propagation for CloudFormation resources, enhanced Windows domain configuration options, default session scheduling, and security enhancements.

announcements.title: AWS Storage Gateway now supports Nutanix AHV hypervisor
announcements.summary: AWS Storage Gateway now supports deployment on the Nutanix AHV hypervisor, enabling organizations using Nutanix's KVM-based virtualization platform to deploy S3 File, Tape, and Volume gateways in their on-premises environments. This integration allows Nutanix AHV users to seamlessly access AWS's virtually unlimited cloud storage through their existing hyper-converged infrastructure.

announcements.title: AWS Wickr launches admin APIs for programmatic network management at scale
announcements.summary: AWS Wickr has launched a suite of admin APIs that enable administrators to programmatically manage secure communication networks at scale. These APIs automate critical administrative workflows including user lifecycle management (creating/deactivating accounts and assigning security groups) and network configuration. The new functionality allows organizations to streamline administrative tasks and manage their Wickr networks more efficiently through automated processes.

announcements.title: Announcing AWS Neuron SDK 2.27.0
announcements.summary: AWS has released Neuron SDK 2.27.0, which adds support for Trainium3 UltraServer and includes several new tools and features with expanded open source components. Key additions include the Neuron Explorer tools suite, Enhanced NKI with an open source compiler, native PyTorch support through TorchNeuron, and Kubernetes-native resource management via Neuron DRA. These updates are designed to enable standard machine learning frameworks to run seamlessly on AWS Trainium infrastructure without requiring code changes.

announcements.title: Amazon Application Recovery Controller region switch now supports three new capabilities
announcements.summary: Amazon Application Recovery Controller (ARC) Region switch has added three new capabilities to help orchestrate multi-Region application failovers to another AWS Region during regional impairments. The service provides bounded recovery times while eliminating hours of manual engineering work previously required for failover procedures. It automates failover steps, dashboard creation, and evidence gathering for successful recovery operations.

announcements.title: AWS Private CA OCSP now available in China and AWS GovCloud (US) Regions
announcements.summary: AWS Private Certificate Authority (AWS Private CA) has expanded its Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) support to China and AWS GovCloud (US) Regions. This enhancement allows real-time certificate validation and revocation status checking for applications using private certificates in these regions. AWS Private CA is a fully managed service that eliminates the operational complexity of maintaining your own certificate authority infrastructure.

announcements.title: Amazon SageMaker Studio now supports SOCI indexing for faster container startup times
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker Studio now supports SOCI (Seekable Open Container Initiative) indexing, which reduces container startup times by 30-50% when using custom images. This enhancement improves the performance of SageMaker Studio, AWS's browser-based machine learning development environment that provides pre-built containers for popular ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.

announcements.title: Amazon RDS enhances observability for snapshot exports to Amazon S3
announcements.summary: Amazon RDS has introduced enhanced observability features for snapshot exports to Amazon S3, providing detailed insights into export progress, failures, and performance through four new event types. These improvements allow users to monitor their snapshot exports with greater granularity and predictability. The feature enables exporting RDS database snapshots to Apache Parquet format in S3 buckets with better visibility into the export process.

announcements.title: Amazon Bedrock Data Automation launches instruction optimization for your document blueprints
announcements.summary: Amazon Bedrock Data Automation (BDA) has launched blueprint instruction optimization, which automatically improves the accuracy of custom field extraction from documents using example assets with ground truth labels. This feature refines natural language instructions in blueprints to better extract insights from unstructured multimodal content including documents, images, audio, and videos. The enhancement helps optimize GenAI-powered applications by automatically improving extraction performance with minimal manual intervention.

announcements.title: Timestream for InfluxDB Now Supports Restart API Calls
announcements.summary: Amazon Timestream for InfluxDB now supports a restart API for both InfluxDB versions 2 and 3, allowing customers to trigger system restarts on their database instances through the AWS Management Console, API, or CLI. This new feature enables customers to perform resilience testing and address health-related issues more efficiently, streamlining operational management of their time-series database environments.

announcements.title: Announcing Cost Allocation Tags support for Account Tags
announcements.summary: AWS has announced support for Cost Allocation Tags with account tags, allowing customers with multiple member accounts to use their existing AWS Organizations account tags directly in cost management tools. Account tags are automatically applied at the account level and cover all metered usage within tagged accounts, removing the need to manually configure separate account groupings in AWS Cost Explorer and Cost and Usage Reports. This enhancement streamlines cost management across multi-account AWS environments.

announcements.title: Amazon ECR now supports creating repositories on push
announcements.summary: Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) now automatically creates repositories when container images are pushed, eliminating the need for users to manually pre-create repositories. This feature streamlines container workflows by using defined repository creation template settings to automatically generate repositories as needed. The capability is available across all AWS regions where ECR is offered.

announcements.title: AWS IoT now offers event-based logging to help optimize observability costs
announcements.summary: AWS IoT has introduced event-based logging, a new feature that allows developers to reduce Amazon CloudWatch costs while improving log management efficiency. This capability enables customizable log levels and destinations for individual IoT events based on their operational importance. For example, developers can set different log levels (like INFO-level) for specific event types such as certificate providers.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications now supports Microsoft Windows Server 2025
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications now supports Microsoft Windows Server 2025, allowing customers to launch streaming instances with the latest server operating system features. This update provides improved security, performance, and modern capabilities for application streaming environments. The new support enables delivery of the Windows 11 desktop experience to end users with enhanced flexibility.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 now supports Availability Zone ID across its APIs
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 now supports Availability Zone ID (AZ ID) parameters across its APIs, allowing users to create and manage resources using consistent zone identifiers that represent the same physical location across all AWS accounts. This replaces the previous system where AZ names could map to different physical locations, making resource placement optimization more reliable and predictable.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications announces Elastic fleets powered by Ubuntu Pro 24.04 LTS
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications now supports Ubuntu Pro 24.04 LTS on Elastic fleets, allowing ISVs and IT organizations to stream Ubuntu desktop applications to users through AWS Cloud infrastructure. This fully managed service enables secure, flexible access to desktops and applications from anywhere while providing scalability and cost-effectiveness.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8a instances now available in the Europe (Spain) region
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8a instances, powered by 5th Gen AMD EPYC processors with up to 4.5 GHz frequency, are now available in the Europe (Spain) region. These compute-optimized instances deliver up to 30% higher performance and 19% better price-performance compared to C7a instances, with 33% more memory bandwidth making them ideal for latency-sensitive workloads.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces now supports IPv6
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces now supports IPv6 connectivity through a dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 configuration, allowing users to connect from compatible clients (except when using SAML authentication). This update helps customers meet IPv6 compliance requirements and reduces costs by eliminating the need for expensive networking equipment to translate between IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

announcements.title: Amazon MSK Connect now supports dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) connectivity for new connectors
announcements.summary: Amazon MSK Connect now supports dual-stack connectivity, allowing customers to create new connectors that use both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols simultaneously, in addition to the existing IPv4-only option. This enhancement helps organizations modernize their applications for IPv6 environments while maintaining backward compatibility with IPv4, facilitating compliance requirements and preparation for future network architectures.

announcements.title: AWS IoT Core adds message batching to HTTP rule action
announcements.summary: AWS IoT Core has introduced message batching functionality for HTTP rule actions, allowing multiple IoT messages to be combined into a single HTTP request before being sent to downstream endpoints. This new feature reduces both cost and throughput overhead when processing telemetry data from IoT workloads by minimizing the number of individual HTTP calls required.

announcements.title: Amazon ECS Managed Instances now supports Amazon EC2 Spot Instances
announcements.summary: Amazon ECS Managed Instances now supports EC2 Spot Instances, allowing users to access spare EC2 capacity at up to 90% discount compared to On-Demand pricing for fault-tolerant workloads. This enhancement maintains AWS's fully managed infrastructure approach while providing significant cost savings through automatic scaling and infrastructure management.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 R8i and R8i-flex instances are now available in additional AWS regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 R8i and R8i-flex instances are now available in three additional AWS regions: Asia Pacific (Seoul), South America (Sao Paulo), and Asia Pacific (Tokyo). These instances are powered by custom Intel Xeon 6 processors exclusive to AWS, offering up to 15% better price-performance and 2.5x more memory bandwidth compared to previous generations.

announcements.title: AWS Direct Connect now supports resilience testing with AWS Fault Injection Service
announcements.summary: AWS Direct Connect now integrates with AWS Fault Injection Service (FIS) to enable controlled resilience testing of applications. This new capability allows users to simulate disruptions to Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) sessions over Virtual Interfaces and observe how their applications respond. The integration helps validate resilience mechanisms and improve application performance and observability through controlled fault injection experiments.

announcements.title: AWS Lambda durable functions are now available in 14 additional AWS Regions
announcements.summary: AWS Lambda durable functions, which allow developers to build reliable multi-step applications and AI workflows, are now available in 14 additional AWS Regions. The expansion includes major regions across the US, Europe, and Asia Pacific, such as US East (N. Virginia), Europe (Ireland), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), and Asia Pacific (Singapore). This broader availability gives developers more geographic options for deploying complex, stateful serverless applications using Lambda's familiar development environment.

announcements.title: Amazon Neptune Database is now available in the AWS Europe (Zurich) Region
announcements.summary: Amazon Neptune Database, AWS's fully managed graph database service, is now available in the Europe (Zurich) Region with engine versions 1.4.5.0 and later. Users can create Neptune clusters in this region using various instance types including R5, R5d, R6g, R6i, X2iedn, T4g, and T3. Neptune enables easy development of applications with highly connected datasets using Apache TinkerPop Gremlin or openCypher query languages.

announcements.title: Amazon MSK introduces KRaft support for Express Brokers with Apache Kafka v3.9
announcements.summary: Amazon MSK now supports Apache Kafka version 3.9 for Express Brokers, introducing KRaft (Kafka Raft) support that eliminates the need for Apache ZooKeeper for metadata management. KRaft moves metadata management from external ZooKeeper nodes to internal Kafka controllers, allowing metadata to be stored and replicated as topics within the Kafka brokers themselves.

announcements.title: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications announces additional health and performance metrics
announcements.summary: Amazon WorkSpaces Applications has introduced new Amazon CloudWatch metrics that allow administrators to monitor the health and performance of fleets, sessions, instances, and users. These metrics can be easily enabled from the CloudWatch console and provide real-time updates to simplify troubleshooting. The new monitoring capabilities help administrators make better decisions about sizing and optimize end-user streaming performance.

announcements.title: AWS Databases are now available on the Vercel Marketplace
announcements.summary: AWS has made three of its database services—Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL, Amazon Aurora DSQL, and Amazon DynamoDB—generally available on the Vercel Marketplace, allowing developers to create and connect to AWS databases directly from Vercel in seconds. New users can create an AWS account through Vercel and receive $100 USD in credits that can be used with any of these database options for up to six months.

announcements.title: Now generally available: Amazon EC2 M8gn and M8gb instances
announcements.summary: AWS has announced the general availability of Amazon EC2 M8gn and M8gb instances powered by AWS Graviton4 processors, which deliver up to 30% better compute performance than Graviton3 processors. The M8gn instances feature 6th generation AWS Nitro Cards and offer up to 600 Gbps network bandwidth (the highest among network-optimized EC2 instances), while M8gb instances provide up to 150 Gbps of EBS bandwidth for enhanced storage performance.

announcements.title: Amazon Aurora now supports PostgreSQL 18.1 in the Amazon RDS Database preview environment
announcements.summary: Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL-Compatible Edition now supports PostgreSQL version 18.1 in the Amazon RDS Database Preview Environment, enabling users to evaluate the latest PostgreSQL features on Aurora. PostgreSQL 18.1 introduces performance improvements including "skip scan" support for multicolumn B-tree indexes, enhanced WHERE clause handling for OR and IN conditions, and parallel GIN index builds.

announcements.title: AWS announces enhanced custom line item controls for AWS Billing Conductor
announcements.summary: AWS Billing Conductor now offers enhanced custom line item controls that allow customers to create service-specific line items scoped to one or multiple AWS services. These line items can be customized in how they appear across billing artifacts like Bills Page, Cost Explorer, and Cost and Usage Records. The improvements enable more precise and tailored charge-back and re-billing strategies for customers.

announcements.title: Amazon EC2 C8g, M8g, R8g instances now available in additional regions
announcements.summary: Amazon EC2 C8g, M8g, and R8g instances powered by AWS Graviton4 processors are now available in AWS GovCloud regions (US-West and US-East). These instances deliver up to 30% better performance compared to Graviton3-based instances and are built on the AWS Nitro System for enhanced performance through dedicated hardware offloading.

announcements.title: Amazon ECR Public now supports PrivateLink for US East (N. Virginia) SDK Endpoint
announcements.summary: Amazon ECR Public now supports AWS PrivateLink for its US East (N. Virginia) SDK endpoint, enabling customers to access the service through private network connections instead of the public internet. This enhancement allows users to establish secure, private connectivity from their Amazon VPC to the ECR Public SDK endpoint, improving network security and reducing public internet exposure.
