announcements.summary: AWS IoT Core has enhanced its IoT rules-SQL with a new SET clause that allows users to set and reuse variables across SQL statements, providing a simpler and more consistent SQL experience. Additionally, a new get_or_default() function has been introduced to improve error handling by returning default values when data encoding or external dependency issues occur, ensuring IoT rules continue executing successfully.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect launches monitoring of contacts queued for callback
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect has introduced a new feature that allows monitoring of contacts waiting in callback queues. The feature enables searching for queued callback contacts and viewing details like customer phone numbers and queue duration through the Connect UI and APIs. This allows businesses to proactively route at-risk contacts to agents before callback timelines are exceeded and better manage customer expectations.

announcements.title: Aurora DSQL launches new Python, Node.js, and JDBC Connectors that simplify IAM authorization
announcements.summary: AWS has released new Aurora DSQL Connectors for Python, Node.js, and JDBC that simplify IAM authentication when connecting to Aurora DSQL clusters using standard PostgreSQL drivers. These connectors automatically handle IAM token generation, eliminating the need for developers to manually write token generation code or supply IAM tokens. The connectors work transparently with popular PostgreSQL drivers like psycopg and psycopg2 for Python.

announcements.title: Amazon EMR 7.12 now supports the Apache Iceberg v3 table format
announcements.summary: Amazon EMR 7.12 now supports Apache Iceberg v3 table format with version 1.10, enabling more cost-effective data deletion by marking deleted rows instead of rewriting entire files. This update improves data pipeline speed, reduces storage costs, and enhances governance through better row-level change tracking and more granular data access controls.

announcements.title: Amazon Connect now enables agents to send follow-up replies to email contacts
announcements.summary: Amazon Connect now allows agents to send follow-up email replies to customers while maintaining the original conversation thread and full history. This feature helps agents provide consistent support by preserving context without needing to start new email threads. The capability is available across multiple AWS regions including US East, US West, Africa (Cape Town), and several Asia Pacific locations.

announcements.title: AWS WAF announces Web Bot Auth support
announcements.summary: AWS WAF now supports Web Bot Auth (WBA), a new feature that provides secure authentication for legitimate AI agents and automated tools accessing web applications. This authentication method uses cryptographic signatures in HTTP messages to verify that requests come from authorized bots. The feature is based on active IETF draft standards and offers a standardized approach to distinguishing legitimate automated traffic from potentially malicious bots.

announcements.title: Second-generation AWS Outposts racks now supported in the AWS Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region
announcements.summary: AWS has expanded support for second-generation Outposts racks to the Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region, allowing organizations in and around Japan to deploy AWS infrastructure on-premises. This expansion enables companies to meet latency and data residency requirements while maintaining a consistent hybrid cloud experience with AWS services, APIs, and tools.

announcements.title: Amazon Aurora DSQL database clusters now support up to 256 TiB of storage volume
announcements.summary: Amazon Aurora DSQL has doubled its maximum storage capacity from 128 TiB to 256 TiB, enabling customers to manage larger datasets within a single database cluster. The service maintains its pay-as-you-use model with automatic storage scaling, eliminating the need for upfront storage provisioning. All Aurora DSQL clusters start with a default 10 TiB storage limit that can be expanded as needed.

announcements.title: AWS announces Flexible Cost Allocation on AWS Transit Gateway
announcements.summary: AWS has announced the general availability of Flexible Cost Allocation (FCA) on AWS Transit Gateway, which provides more versatile options for distributing Transit Gateway costs across organizations. Previously, Transit Gateway only used a sender-pay model where the source attachment account owner paid all data usage costs, but FCA now allows organizations to configure different cost allocation strategies through a central metering policy.

announcements.title: Amazon Athena adds cost and performance controls for Capacity Reservations
announcements.summary: Amazon Athena has introduced new cost and performance controls for Capacity Reservations, allowing users to configure Data Processing Unit (DPU) settings at both the workgroup and individual query levels. This feature enables users to balance cost efficiency, concurrency, and performance by setting explicit DPU values for queries running on dedicated serverless processing capacity.

announcements.title: AWS Security Incident Response now provides agentic AI-powered investigation
announcements.summary: AWS Security Incident Response has introduced an agentic AI-powered investigation feature that automatically collects and correlates evidence from multiple AWS data sources during security events. The AI agent presents findings in clear, actionable summaries to help security teams investigate and respond to incidents more quickly. This capability aims to reduce response times and minimize business disruption from security events.

announcements.title: Amazon Location Service introduces Address Form Solution Builder
announcements.summary: AWS has launched Address Form Solution Builder from Amazon Location Service, a no-code tool that allows developers to create customized address forms with predictive suggestions and autofill capabilities. The solution provides a guided experience to generate ready-to-use applications in minutes, with downloadable packages available in React JavaScript, React TypeScript, or Standalone HTML/JavaScript formats.

announcements.title: AWS Cost Anomaly Detection accelerates anomaly identification
announcements.summary: AWS Cost Anomaly Detection has upgraded its algorithm to identify unusual spending patterns faster by analyzing costs using rolling 24-hour windows and comparing them against equivalent periods from previous days. The enhanced system processes data each time AWS receives updated cost and usage information, eliminating previous delays in anomaly detection. This improvement addresses common challenges in cost pattern analysis by providing more timely alerts about spending irregularities.

announcements.title: AWS Transfer Family announces Terraform module to integrate with a custom identity provider
announcements.summary: AWS Transfer Family has released a new Terraform module that enables automated deployment of Transfer Family endpoints integrated with custom identity providers (IdPs) for authentication and access control. This module allows organizations to streamline the setup of fully-managed file transfer services (SFTP, AS2, FTPS, FTP, and web-based) while leveraging their existing identity management systems through Infrastructure as Code.

announcements.title: Introducing one-click onboarding of existing datasets to Amazon SageMaker
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker has launched one-click onboarding that allows customers to quickly import their existing AWS datasets into SageMaker Unified Studio using their current IAM roles and permissions. The feature includes a new serverless notebook with a built-in AI agent that supports SQL, Python, Spark, and natural language, enabling data engineers, analysts, and data scientists to start working with their data within minutes.

announcements.title: Introducing Amazon SageMaker Data Agent for analytics and AI/ML development
announcements.summary: Amazon SageMaker has launched the SageMaker Data Agent, a built-in AI agent available in the new notebook experience within Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio. The agent helps data engineers, analysts, and data scientists by automatically generating code and execution plans from natural language prompts, reducing the time spent on manual setup tasks and boilerplate code. This tool accelerates the development of data analytics and machine learning applications by streamlining the workflow process.
